inclusion.criterion: Must understand the risks and the benefits/purpose of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must be 18 years at time of signing the informed consent form
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to participate in all required evaluations and procedures in the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have a diagnosis of DM based upon the characteristic cutaneous findings proposed by Sontheimer[6] and/or a skin biopsy consistent with DM.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients must be candidate for systemic therapy for their DM skin disease defined by inadequate response to aggressive sun protection along with the use of potent topical corticosteroids and/or immunomodulators.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with a diagnosis of dermatomyositis on steroid-sparing agent and/or systemic steroids (maximum dose of prednisone 1mg/Kg) and still having cutaneous disease activity of at least 5 on the CDASI scale.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If on immunosuppressive treatments and/or steroids, patients must be on stable doses for at least 4 weeks (28 days).
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients must undergo age appropriate cancer screening.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Females of childbearing potential (FCBP) must have a negative pregnancy test at screening (day 0 of the study and every month throughout the study).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: While on investigational product and for at least 28 days after taking the last dose of investigational product.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Increasing or changing dose of topical therapy within 14 days of study day 0 (including but not limited to topical corticosteroids, tacrolimus, pimecrolimus).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Increasing or changing systemic steroids dosing within 28 days of study day 0.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of any clinically significant (as determined by the investigators) cardiac, endocrinologic, pulmonary, neurologic, psychiatric, hepatic, renal, hematologic, immunologic, or other major uncontrolled disease.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 16-year-old girl recently diagnosed with myasthenia gravis. She has symptoms of diplopia and weakness affecting her upper extremities. She had a positive anti-AChR antibody test, and her single fiber electromyography (SFEMG) was positive.
